analysis: The documents all pertain to the establishment, modification, or termination of Presidential advisory committees, commissions, boards, or councils. These entities are created to address a wide range of issues, from national productivity and urban families to violence prevention, drug abuse, social security reform, election integrity, and various aspects of economic and social welfare. The documents detail the composition of these groups, their functions, administrative support, and termination dates. A common theme is the use of distinguished citizens and experts to advise the President on complex issues, reflecting a reliance on external expertise to inform policy decisions.
title: Presidential Advisory Groups on National Issues
